meanings.definition: The act of detesting or abhorring something.
meanings.sent1: Her detestations of spiders made her scream whenever she saw one.
meanings.sent2: His detestations of broccoli were well-known among his friends.
meanings.sent3: Despite his detestations of early mornings, he had to wake up at 6 am for work.
meanings.sent4: The detestations of injustice burned within her, driving her to fight for equality.
meanings.sent5: The detestations of war echoed through the generations, leaving scars on the land.

meanings.definition: Strong dislike or hatred towards something.
meanings.sent1: The child's detestations of vegetables often led to dinner-time battles.
meanings.sent2: Her detestations of public speaking made her avoid presentations at all costs.
meanings.sent3: His detestations of rainy days were evident as he grumbled about the weather.
meanings.sent4: The detestations of betrayal cut deep, leaving wounds that took time to heal.
meanings.sent5: The detestations of cruelty in the world fueled her passion for helping others.
